about.online_tool: Living Dictionaries are mobile-friendly web tools that support endangered, under-represented and diasporic languages.
about.promote_connectivity: Led by community activists around the globe, Living Dictionaries are collaborative multimedia projects that help languages survive for generations to come.
about.td_beginnings: Originally known as “Talking Dictionary” software, our platform was first launched in 2006 by Living Tongues linguists Gregory D. S. Anderson and K. David Harrison. In 2020, Living Tongues Institute updated the name of the tool to Living Dictionaries.
about.manage_entries: Manage Dictionary: View & Edit Entries in Real-Time
about.private_public: Set Dictionaries as Private or Public
about.language_is_history: Languages are humanity's living history; they encode centuries of ancestral wisdom related to the environment, local culture and much more. Language is the vital, creative lens through which we perceive the world and express ourselves. There are over 3,000 threatened and endangered languages in the world, and it is up to our current generation to address this urgent problem before it's too late.
about.important_to_document: Not only is it important to scientifically document and preserve endangered languages, but from an educational standpoint, learning one's heritage language is a boost for communities who wish to conserve and celebrate their cultural identity, locally as well as internationally. Knowing about one's linguistic and cultural origins has significant, positive health impacts, and this translates to better well-being of the community in the long-term.
about.what_is_LT: What is Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages?
about.leading_research: Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages is a leading research organization dedicated to documenting endangered languages. Founded by linguist Dr. Gregory D. S. Anderson, Living Tongues Institute is a non-profit research institute based in Salem, Oregon, with remote researchers and collaborators located around the globe.
about.two_decades_experience: With nearly two decades of fieldwork experience, researchers at Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages have the skills and methods in place to help communities document, protect, and promote their languages.
about.help_us_launch_more: Help Us Launch More Living Dictionaries
about.with_your_help: With your help, we can continue to improve our software and make it available for any community that wishes to create their own Living Dictionary. Donate today and make an impact!
about.question_1: Please provide some background information about this language. Where is it spoken? What communities speak this language? Is this language endangered?
about.question_2: What are the names of the people who built this dictionary? Whose voices are in this dictionary?
about.question_3: Where did the data in this dictionary come from? Please describe if you collected the data yourself. If you used any published reference sources, please list them.
about.question_4: Who will be using this dictionary? Will it be used in any educational projects?
about.question_5: If you want the public to contact you about this project, please provide your contact information, or a link to where people can learn more. This is optional.
about.message: Before making your dictionary public, please complete the About section.

contributors.ld_produced_by: This Living Dictionary was produced at Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages under the direction of the following people:
contributors.all_rights_reserved_permission: All rights reserved. Do not distribute or reproduce without permission.
contributors.manager_contributor_distinction: Note: Dictionary managers may add, edit or delete content. Contributors are project collaborators who can also add and edit, but cannot delete any content.
contributors.how_to_cite_instructions: Add the authors of this dictionary to show their names in the citation

audio.tapToStopRecording: Then you will tap to stop recording

create.speech_community_permission: Does the speech community allow this language to be online? Select 'OK' if they have given you permission.
create.at_least_one_lang: Choose at least 1 language to make the dictionary available in.
create.only_letters_numbers: Only letters and numbers allowed (no spaces or special characters)
create.gloss_dictionary_clarification: Language(s) you want to translate entries into.
create.name_clarification: This will be the name of the dictionary.
create.permanent_url_msg: The URL name is permanent and cannot be changed later.
create.add_gloss_msg: You can add more glossing languages later in under Settings.
create.language_used_by_community: Is this dictionary for a language that is spoken or signed by a specific human community?
create.community_permission: Has the language community given you permission to make this dictionary?
create.author_connection: Please briefly describe how you know this language and why you are creating a Living Dictionary for it. Are you part of the community that will be using this Living Dictionary? If not, how do you know the community?
create.con_lang_description: Is this dictionary for a constructed language (a language invented by humans in recent years, for a book or a movie)? If yes, please briefly describe.
create.map_instructions: Click on the map to add secondary coordinates.
create.conlang_question: Is this a constructed language or an artificial language?
create.conlang_info_1: Since our mission focuses on documenting endangered and minority natural human languages, we do not offer technical support for constructed languages (conlangs) or artificial languages. Due to our small team and limited hours of operation, we do not offer data imports for conlangs.
create.conlang_info_2: Living Dictionaries for constructed languages will not be made public on our website or available on our homepage map. If we see derogatory content in this Living Dictionary, we also reserve the right to delete it.
create.agree_to_cite: I agree to cite any relevant published works within dictionary entries.
create.agree_for_non-commercial: I agree that this work is non-commercial.
create.source_question: Where did the data in this dictionary come from? Please describe if you collected the data yourself. If you used any published reference sources, please list them here.
create.use_question: Who will be using this dictionary? Will it be used in any educational or media projects?
create.conlang_warning: If this dictionary is for a constructed (or artificial) language, and you do not indicate that, we reserve the right to remove it.

misc.out_of_service:
Thank you for visiting our website! This page is temporarily under construction.
It will not be available between February 3 and February 28, 2025.
Please visit this page again on March 1, 2025.
You will be able to create new Living Dictionaries at that time.
Sorry for the inconvenience, and thank you for your patience.
In the meantime, the rest of the platform is working normally.

settings.community_permission: Does the speech community allow this language to be online?
settings.public_private_meaning: Public means anyone can see your dictionary which requires community consent. Private dictionaries are visible only to you and your collaborators.
settings.unable_to_delete: Note: you will not be able to delete these glossing languages later.
settings.print_access_meaning: This gives the public the ability to download and print this Living Dictionary as a .PDF

export.availability: Export is only available to dictionary managers

video.prepare_to_record_video: Prepare to Record with Microphone & Camera
video.video_info: There are two ways to have your videos displayed in a Living Dictionary: 1) You can record your videos right here, or upload your previously recorded videos to our platform. Advantages: easy and great for quick recordings. Disadvantages: You can only upload a video up to 100MB so it must only be short and low resolution. 2) Have your videos on a hosting service that specializes in video storage and link the URL to our site. Advantages: easy (as long as your videos are already uploaded on that platform), your videos can have the resolution and length you want. Disadvantages: if you want to record something unexpected or very simple, it might be too much effort to do it that way, and you may want to prioritize method 1.
video.previously_dismissed_msg: If you previously dismissed the browser's request, please reload and click 'Yes' when your browser asks for permission.
video.permission_denied: Permission to access media was denied.

print.availability: Print view is only available to dictionary managers and contributors

import_page.instructions_1: If you already have linguistic data that you want to import into your Dictionary, please follow the steps below.
import_page.instructions_2: Click on the blue “Link to Template” button below. Download the template as an Excel file, or create a copy on Google Docs. Edit the template according to your project’s needs. Copy and paste your data into the spreadsheet.
import_page.instructions_3: Use the “Contact Us” below to contact us. Let us know that you have a new spreadsheet that is ready for import. Ask us any questions you have. We will respond to you by email, and then you can send us your file.
import_page.instructions_4: To send us data exported from dictionary softwares like FLEx, Lexique Pro, Shoebox, please use the “Contact Us” button below and tell us the details of your project.
import_page.no_imports: We are currently working with many communities and partner organizations to import a large number of dictionary entries to this platform. We are also making big updates to our database. We will accept new data imports starting on July 1, 2024. We appreciate your patience, and we apologize for the inconvenience.

banner.message: We are making improvements to our database on October 22 starting at 7PM Eastern Time (New York), for 24 hours. Editing capabilities will not be available during that period. Sorry for the inconvenience.
